feature.name: Ranger Archetype: Oath of the Heart (HB)
feature.text:
This is the true ranger, a wilderness warrior who doesn't use magic. A ranger from the Wild One subclass is especially agile and adept at moving through the wilderness.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Cunning Action (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Land Stride (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spikes, or a similar hazard. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Survivalist (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
When you choose this archetype, you gain proficiency in the Nature and Survival skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these proficiencies.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Uncanny Dodge (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Supreme Sneak (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
You have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Extra Attack (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
You can attack three times instead of two whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Wise Warrior (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
As an action, you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn't incapacitated, contested by the target's Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature for 1 minute.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Stalker's Flurry (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
You learn to attack with such unexpected speed that you can turn a miss into another strike. Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Elusive (Oath of the Heart (HB))
feature.text:
You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 151 (Homebrew)
